recipes.title: Buttermilk Pancakes
ingredients: 3 tablespoon unsalted butter melted, plus 1/2 teaspoon for griddle

instructions.stepOne: Heat griddle to 375. Whisk flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and sugar in a bowl. Add eggs, buttermilk, and 4 tablespoons butter; whisk to combine. Batter should have small to medium lumps. Allow batter to rest for 20-30 mins
instructions.stepTwo: Heat oven to 175, to warm pancakes while cooking. Test griddle by sprinkling a few drops of water on it. If water bounces and spatters off griddle, it is not enough. Using a pastry brush, brush remaining 1/2 teaspoon butter or reserved bacon fat onto griddle. Wipe off excess.
instructions.stepThree: Using a 4-oz ladle, about 1/2 cup, pour batter into pools 2 inches apart. When pancakes buddle on top and are slightly dry around edges, about 2-2 1/2 minutes, flip. Cook until golden on bottom, about 1 minute. Repeat with remaining batter; keep finished pancakes on a heat-proof plate in the oven.

instructions.stepOne: Place the lettuce in a large bowl and cover with ice water. Let soak for 15 to 20 minutes to get crisp, then drain. Dry the lettuce either in a salad spinner or using towels, then transfer to a large bowl.
instructions.stepTwo: Add the feta, dill and scallions, and drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper, toss to combine and serve.

instructions.stepOne: Cream together: shortening, sugar, vanilla thoroughly. Add 1 egg at a time to the mixture and beat well.
instructions.stepTwo: Sift the flour, baking powder, and baking soda together. Add the dry ingredients and alternatively add the sour cream to the creamed mixture. Mix well.
instructions.stepThree: Spread half of batter in a 10 inch (removable) tube pan that has been greased and lined on the bottom with wax paper.
